Description: Rim and body sherd of North Ionian Late Wild Goat Style shallow pottery plate; exterior reserved; interior slipped white: black maeander pattern on rim, wheel-incised groove near join to floor and a wide ridge at the junction; on floor, part of haunch and left hind leg of goat to left, standing on ground line of maeander band between double lines; in exergue, possibly inverted rays; on edge of rim, black vertical bands; single repair hole through exergue.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

According to pottery analysis by P. Dupont (personal communication, 30-31 May 1978) at the Centre de recherches archéologiques, laboratoire de céramologie, Lyon, the clay from this sherd originated in North Ionia. Modern inscription written in ink 'NAU 1' on break (accession number used in clay analysis). According to Dupont and Thomas (2006, p. 80), the geochemical characteristics of the fabric point to an origin in the region of Teos. Sherd belongs to the same vessel as British Museum 1924,1201.1106
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 80-1, Nau 16, pl. 4b)
Dupont & Thomas 2006 / Naukratis: Les Importations Grecques Orientales Archaïques (p. 78-80, 82, 84, fig. 4) (Nau 52)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.785)
